constituent: delight, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, lack, yawn
heisigStory: Again I cannot resist sharing my own associations. If you've ever seen Disney's animated interpretation of classical music, "Fantasia," you will recall what was done there with Beethoven's "Pastoral Symphony" (the 6th), and the flying horses that figured in it. The mares are bathing in the stream and the stallions begin to gather. As dusk sets in, the flying horses all start yawning and pair off for the night: a perfectly delightful portrait of delight.
koohiiStory1: Imagine a spoiled little girl. Her delight when she gets a Pegasus for her birthday... and then like all spoilt little girls she gets bored of it quickly... hence the yawn.
koohiiStory2: I would be delighted if Japanese lacked the Pegasus kanji.
myStory: vui. thoả mãn. thiếu con chim buổi trưa nên thoải mái
words:
歓声(かんせい): cheer, shout of joy
歓迎(かんげい): welcome, reception
